name: Xiao Liang 0014
content: Xiao Liang - CUHK CSE Top Xiao Liang （梁宵） I'm an assistant professor in the CSE Department at CUHK. I'm interested in Cryptography and its intersections with related fields such as Quantum Computing, Computational Complexity, and Computer Security. My work has concentrated on theoretical fundamentals, including Zero-Knowledge Protocols, Secure Multi-Party Computation, Non-Malleability, Digital Signatures, as well as their practical applications. I'm lucky to work with a group of curious and creative students. Together, we form the CryptoPlus Lab! Prior to my appointment at CUHK, I was a Postdoctoral Fellow at NTT Research, working with Vipul Goyal. Before that, I was a Postdoctoral Associate at Rice University, working with Nai-Hui Chia and Kai-Min Chung. I obtained my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stony Brook University, where I was fortunate to be advised by Omkant Pandey. Before that, I received an M.S. in Applied Math from Stony Brook University, and a Bachelor of Economics from Beijing Institute of Technology. Photo by Fangfang Song at Victoria Harbour Teaching CSCI3350 Introduction to Quantum Computing (2026 Spring) CSCI3160 Design and Analysis of Algorithms (2025 Fall) CMSC5719 - Lecture 5: An Introductory Lecture on Quantum Computing (2025 Fall) CSCI5370 Quantum Computing (2025 Spring) Fun Facts about Me Theoretical Toys — my always-unfinished notes on mathematical tools for theoretical computer science. I used to write Chinese poetry (both classical and modern) and won the 2nd prize at the 2015 Chinese Poetry Writing Competition for Chinese-Speaking Undergrads and Grads. Check my award-winning work with comments from the famous lyricist and poet Vincent Fang (Chinese: 方文山). [More works of me] I won the National Scholarship when I majored in Economics, an area in which I have since lost interest.
